reviews.review_msg: If you stay at home and read your textbook you don't need to stick around for lectures. Her lectures appear to be copied and pasted from the text. The quizzes and exams are pretty easy. But the lectures were boring and as I said, unnecessary. Ps  Her tattoo is suuuper lame.

I don't understand all of the negative comments here... I had Katherine for Psyc 100 last semester, and I had her again for 102 this semester; her lectures are engaging, she is fun to talk to, she loves the material, and her marking scheme (including her exams, quizzes, and assignments) is very fair. Her TM Sara is awesome, too!

She's the TA for 362 this semester, not helpful at all, ask her question she ignore you and show you how annoying you are. No wonder she became the TA after being a prof from last semester. She can't be the prof for this class, if so, the fun class will become boring...Worst TA and Prof in SFU
The class was okay, but the TA marker was horrible, super hard & picky on the papers~

She was good and thorough, packed a lot of information into an intersession class. Assignment was based on movie analysis -- which I liked. TA (Natalie) was really hard marker; make sure you've got the APA style down. Exams were pretty hard but generally fair, a few of the questions were worded kind of strangely though. Awesome guest lecturers!
The exams were sooo hard! I was hoping this class would be interesting, but it wasn't. I found that the prof had no personality when you approach her for help and that she cold.

Ok as a teacher but the exams are out there to trick you.  Do not recommend this course.  You can study all the lectures and readings and still come out of the exam feeling like you don't know anything.

she is good at teaching but her multiple choice exams ar tricky!! the written part is pretty easy... the essays you have to write arent bad.. but the way they mark them is really picky. Overall it was a really interesting class

The most ambiguous exams I have ever seen.  Tries to trick students with M/C answers like " the two of the above are true".  Don't be fooled by the lectures- the exams require memorization of every single word of the readings
